document_data.mainbody:
olly was once a living parrot with a sassy lip and colorful coat of feathers who later became a stuffed bird of Torleths Treasures of Gillians Hill.
In 1372 DR, Polly was a staple of Torleth Mindulspeers curio shop in Gillians Hill. The bird was stuffed, displayed on a perch, and posed with its head to the side as if listening attentively to the stores many guests. A note was attached to Pollys claw which read "Poor Polly! She mimicked the captain one too many times. May she perch in peace."
